title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 142-2.19 - Meal
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 142-2.19 - Meal

State Regulations
A
meal
shall provide adequate portions
of a variety of wholesome, nutritious foods, and shall include at least one of
the types of foods from all four of the following groups: (a) fruits or vegetables; (b) cereals, bread or potatoes; (c) eggs, meat, fish or poultry; (d) milk, tea or coffee; except that for
breakfast, group (c) may be omitted if both cereal and bread are offered in
group (b). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
142-2.19

Amended

New

York State Register December 28, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 52, eff. 12/31/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
